org.gearvrf

Class GVRBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRAnimator, GVRBillboard, GVRExternalScene, GVRLODGroup, GVRPicker, GVRRenderTarget, GVRScriptBehavior, GVRSwitch

    public class GVRBehavior
extends GVRComponent
implements GVRDrawFrameListener
    Base class for adding user-defined behaviors to a scene object. You can override callbacks for initialization and per-frame updates. This class listens for draw frame events when it is attached to a scene object. You can override these callbacks to implement custom components. - onDrawFrame(float frametime) called once every frame before rendering. - onAttach(GVRSceneObject) called when this behavior is attached to a scene object. - onDetach(GVRSceneObject) called when this behavior is detached from a scene object.
    See Also:
    GVRComponent, GVRSceneObject.attachComponent(GVRComponent), GVRSceneObject.getComponent(long), GVRSceneObject.detachComponent(long)

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(GVRSceneObject newOwner)
        Called when this behavior is attached to a scene object. Attaching a behavior to a scene object will cause it to start listening to scene events.
        Overrides:
        onAttach in class GVRComponent
        Parameters:
        newOwner - GVRSceneObject the behavior is attached to.

      • onDetach

        public void onDetach(GVRSceneObject oldOwner)
        Called when this behavior is detached from a scene object. Detaching a behavior from a scene object will cause it to stop listening to scene events (onStep won't be called).
        Overrides:
        onDetach in class GVRComponent
        Parameters:
        oldOwner - GVRSceneObject the behavior was detached from.

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float frameTime)
        Called each frame before rendering the scene. It is not called if this behavior is not attached to a GVRSceneObject.
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Parameters:
        frameTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()
